description: Length: approx. 2mm - 2.5mm. Color: iridescent, head green with gold tinge, thorax blue-green, brown gaster with blue-green reflections ; raised smnooth tubercle bright red and yellow; dorsellum band iridescent blue-green. Legs: coxae green, pro-, meso femora and tibiae brown to yellow, lighter on distad and inner surfaces, hind femora with blue-green reflections, tarsi yellow. Antenna(color): scape brown; pedicel brown; flagellum brown. Head: in frontal view quadrate, slightly wider than high, HW/HH approx. 1.3; in dorsal view transverse, width slightly greater than twice length, HW/HL 2.1-2.2; slightly wider than pronotum, HW/PW approx. 1.1.-1.2. Frontal carina: absent. Scrobal cavity: shallow, with sides of scrobal cavity expanded. Ocelli: normal size, wider than F1; POL at least twice OOL. conspicuously swollen ridge originating from between median and lateral ocelli towards lower eye margin; rounded behind, slightly invaginated towards median ocellus; interocellular region with alveolae around ocelli, with strong transverse costulae, anterior costulae recurved towards median ocellus, without distinct posterior carina. Outer orbits: imbricate, stronger costulae behind. Inner orbits: in lateral view expanded, gradually narrowing from top to middle of eye; coriaceous. Malar space: about one-fifth eye height,  MS/EH approx. 0.2; malar sulcus distinct; glabrous, with weak piliferous puncta. Clypeus: transverse, much wider than high, CW/CH 2.1-2.2; lateral sulci strong and straight, strongly divergent; tentorial pits deep; epistomal sulcus deeper and more distinct than lateral sulci; straight or weakly concave; only slightly extended ventrad; lower margin convex. Supraclypeal area: longer, 0.6-0.7 clypeus height. Antenna: long, approx. 0.6 EH; glabrous, without apical punctures. longer than wide. pedicel longer than F1, PL/F1L approx. 1.7-2.0. 0.5 F1L. Mesosoma: in dorsal view slighter longer than wide, ML/MW approx. 1.1-1.2. Pronotum in dorsal view: short, about one-quarter length of mesoscutum, PN/MSC 0.2-0.3; almost as long at midline as laterad (.9); anterior margin rounded, without a distinct edge. Lateral panel of pronotum: flat, with 2 rows punctures with coriarious patch, with rounded margin; with weak flange on pronotal panel at the level of mesothoracic spiracle; narrower than prepectus, LPN/PPT approx. 0.6. Prepectus: broad isosceles triangle, well separated from pronotum; central area glabrous, with many small foveae along dorsal and posterior margins. Raised smooth transverse tubercle: present. Midlobe of mesoscutum: with angulate punctures and narrow interspaces, widened on anterior median mesoscutum. Lateral lobe of mesoscutum: strongly coriaceous, with weak angulate punctures and wide coriaceous interspaces. Scutellum (length): about as long as mesoscutum, SC/MSC approx.1.0; with angulate punctures and narrow interspaces. Axilla: alveolate dorsad, imbricate laterad. Axillula: short and triangular, only as long as width at base, glabrous. Propodeum: long, length along midline about one-third width of propodeum; alveolate-rugose laterad without distinctive lateral plicae, delimited ventrad by plicae, dorsad by transverse band of foveae and long median carina; weakly imbricate, with weak foveae along thin median carina. Forewing: very long postmarginal vein,  0.8-0.9 length of marginal vein, 2-3 length of stigmal vein. petiole with exposed dorsal suface short and straplike, glabrous, without raised dorsal surface. Gs1: not examined; acrosternite not examined. Gt2: glabrous, posterior margin weakly concave. Gt3: glabrous.

Length: approx. 2.5mm. Color: iridiscent, head, pronotum, prepectus, and lateral sides of lateral lobes of mesoscutum gold and red, mesoscutum and scutellum red and black, rest of thorax blue-green or violet, gaster gold-green; raised smooth tubercle same color as mesoscutum; dorsellum band iridiscent blue. Legs: coxae, femora, and tibiae brown, lighter on distad and on inner surfaces, with weak violet reflections, stronger on hind femora, tarsi brown. Antenna(color): scape brown with weak iridescent reflections; pedicel brown; flagellum brown. Head: in frontal view quadrate, slightly wider than high, HW/HH 1.2-1.3; in dorsal view transverse, width slightly greater than twice length, HW/HL 2.1-2.2; slightly wider than pronotum, HW/PW approx. 1.1.-1.2. Frontal carina: absent. Scrobal cavity: shallow, with sides of scrobal cavity expanded. Ocelli: small, about as wide as F1; POL at least twice OOL. conspicuously swollen ridge originating from between median and lateral ocelli towards lower eye margin; rounded behind; interocellular region weakly rugose, with strong transverse costulae and distinct posterior carina. Outer orbits: glabrous, with strong costulae behind. Inner orbits: in lateral view expanded, gradually narrowing from top to middle of eye; glabrous, smooth and shining. Malar space: long, greater than one-quarter eye height, MS/EH approx.0.3; malar sulcus distinct; glabrous, with weak piliferous puncta. Clypeus: subquadrate, wider than high, CW/CH approx. 1.9; lateral sulci weak and straight, strongly divergent; tentorial pits deep; epistomal sulcus concave, deeper and more distinct than lateral sulci, only slightly extended ventrad; lower margin convex. Supraclypeal area: longer, 0.6-0.7 clypeus height. Antenna: long, approx. 0.6 EH; glabrous, without apical punctures. longer than wide. pedicel subequal in length to F1, PL/F1L 0.9-1.3; approx. 0.3 F1L. Mesosoma: in dorsal view slighter longer than wide, ML/MW approx. 1.1-1.2. Pronotum in dorsal view: short, about one-quarter length of mesoscutum, PN/MSC 0.2-0.3; shorter along midline, 0.7-0.8 length laterad; anterior margin sharp, with a distinct edge. Lateral panel of pronotum: flat, with 3 rows punctures, with a angulate margin; without weak flange on pronotal panel at the level of mesothoracic spiracle; about as wide as prepectus, LPN/PPT approx. 1.0. Prepectus: broad isosceles triangle, well separated from pronotum; central area glabrous, with many small foveae along dorsal and posterior margins. Raised smooth transverse tubercle: present. Midlobe of mesoscutum: with angulate punctures and narrow interspaces, widened and coriaceous on anterior mesoscutum. Lateral lobe of mesoscutum: strongly coriaceous, with weak angulate punctures and wide coriaceous interspaces. Scutellum (length): about as long as mesoscutum, SC/MSC approx.1.0; with angulate punctures and narrow interspaces. Axilla: densely alveolate dorsad, imbricate laterad. Axillula: short and triangular, only as long as width at base, glabrous. Propodeum: long, length along midline about one-third width of propodeum; alveolate-rugose laterad without distinctive lateral plicae, delimited ventrad by plicae, dorsad by transverse band of foveae and long median carina; weakly imbricate, with weak foveae along thin median carina. Forewing: very long postmarginal vein,  0.8-0.9 length of marginal vein, 2-3 length of stigmal vein. petiole with exposed dorsal suface short and straplike, glabrous, without raised dorsal surface. Gs1: not examined; acrosternite not examined. Gt2: glabrous, posterior margin truncate, weakly coriaceous along midline, weakly imbricate laterad. Gt3: imbricate-punctuate dorsad and laterad, each puncture formed of two smaller punctures.

Color: black, with weakly iridescent blue tinge on scutellum and rarely on mesoscutum; dorsellum band iridiscent blue. Legs: coxae black, femora and tibia brown to yellow, lighter on distad and inner surfaces surfaces, with blue-green reflections, stronger on hind femora, tarsi white; Antenna(color): scape brown; pedicel brown; flagellum yellow. Head: in frontal view quadrate, slightly wider than high, HW/HH 1.2-1.3; Frontal carina: absent. Scrobal cavity: shallow, with sides of scrobal cavity expanded. Ocelli: normal size, wider than F1; weakly swollen ridge originating from between median and lateral ocelli towards lower eye margin; rounded behind; shallow groove originating from median ocellus to posterior head margin, with strong costulae behind, without distinct posterior carina; Outer orbits: weakly imbricate, stronger costulae behind; Inner orbits: in lateral view expanded, gradually narrowing from top to middle of eye; Malar space: short, less than one-fifth eye height, MS/EH approx. .15; malar sulcus distinct, and an abrupt change in sculpture; anterior margin rounded, without a distinct edge. Forewing: long postmarginal vein, 0.8-0.9 length of marginal vein, 1.4-1.6 length of stigmal vein.
